chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Adam L. McCartney was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

timeConds.notes: With Huber and Good Time Credit

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JOC Returned - Remailed to 811 Ransom St, Ripon WI  54971 as per PP Agreement

ADDRESS INFO for Adam L. McCartney
Current: 811 Ransom St, Ripon, WI 54971 United States  (Effective: 02-17-2016)
Prior: 1314 Edward Ct, West Bend, WI 53095

15CM473, 15CM430, 15TR3194, & 15TR3195-Cases called at 1:54 pm. Defendant Adam L. McCartney in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Defendant Adam L. McCartney in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record.  15CM473-Amended complaint addressed. Attorney Zamzow confirms receipt, waives formal reading.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 in 15CM473, No Contest to Count 1 & Count 2 of 15CM430.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 of 15CM473 and dismisses and reads-in Count 3 of 15CM473, Counts 3, 4, & 5 of 15CM430, 15TR3194 & 15TR3195. Court stentences the defendant to: COUNT 1 of 15CM473- SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.  CONDITIONS:  77 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 58 days served. $1744.00 fine inclusive of costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 24 month DL revocation, 24 mo IID-effective today, OWI assessment. COUNT 1 & 2 of 15CM430- SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS: AODA and Follow through.   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Restitution of $144.48 to be paid by April 1, 2016. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Zamzow requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

BOND APPLICABLE TO BOTH 15CM430 & 15CM473.   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.  Defendant is prohibited from issuing any checks for payment or maintaining any open checking accounts.
DE and Atty Szilagyi appear via video from the WC Jail.

15CM430 & 15CM473 Cases called @ 1:18 p.m. Defendant Adam L. McCartney in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaints Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD.  ADA Anderson requesting a $1000 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting a $500 Cash Bond. Court orders $1000 Cash Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 02:05 pm.
